description.narrative: (Vietnam): The Vietnam Forests and Deltas (VFD) activity supports the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development (MARD) in adopting land-use practices to reduce, stop, and reverse emissions from the forestry and agriculture sectors and build resilience..With FY 2019 funds, VFD will support MARD to continue advancing domestic resource mobilization to better protect forests through expansion of Vietnam's Payment for Forest Environmental Services (PFES) system. PFES is a system whereby users of forest services (e.g., hydropower plants) pay for water services produced by forests which then provides funds to individuals and communities to protect and manage their forest lands. The expansion of the system includes additional consumers of services (e.g. thermal power and concrete factories), application of electronic payment services for greater transparency, and the development of a robust monitoring system. VFD will provide training to MARD on the application of several electronic payment methods for distributing PFES payments in Son La, Lam Dong, and Thanh Hoa provinces, as well as support to review the results and develop policy recommendations. VFD will also continue to support MARD to pilot payment for forest sequestration services in two provinces and scale those pilots to the national level via decree. In addition, VFD will support MARD to refine its monitoring and evaluation (M&E) systems to track the effectiveness of the PFES system using lessons drawn from the field pilots..By improving the efficiency, security, and transparency of the PFES system, USAID is enabling Vietnam to increase the mobilization of domestic resources to conserve and restore the country's forests, thereby enhancing natural resource management and supporting the Indo-Pacific vision. Mobilizing domestic resources is a key element of the Journey to Self-Reliance... ..
